definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: All the shit that they could find.
sentences.chinese: 他们只会发现一堆狗屁倒灶的事情。

sentences.english: Life is always full of shit.
sentences.chinese: 生活总是充满了狗屁倒灶的事情。

sentences.english: The motion picture is a real turkey.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影真是狗皮倒灶。

definition: an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
to mess sth up/to screw up
same as 軟腳蝦|软脚虾[ruan3 jiao3 xia1]
(modal final particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la5])
mile (unit of length equal to 1,609.344 m)/old form of modern 英里[Ying1 li3]
to cause sth unfortunate to happen (to oneself or sb else)/to do sth inauspicious/to have a stroke of bad luck
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
not a single grain was reaped (as in a bad harvest year)
